root.para: Authorization can affect the financial statement assertions both directly and indirectly. For example, even if a transaction is executed outside an entity’s policies, it nonetheless may be recorded and accounted for accurately. However, unauthorized transactions could significantly increase risk to the entity, thereby significantly increasing the risk of material misstatement because they would be undertaken outside the system of internal control. To mitigate this risk, an entity will often establish a clear policy regarding what transactions can be traded by whom, and adherence to this policy will then be monitored by an entity’s administrative and support services. Monitoring trading activities of individuals (for example, by reviewing unusually high volumes or significant gains or losses incurred) will assist management in ensuring compliance with the entity’s policies, including the authorization of new types of transactions, and evaluating whether fraud has occurred.
